snippet: Two Tunisians were held in connection with the killing of an American ambassador and three others in Libya on Sept. 11. It was not clear if they were considered suspects or witnesses.
abstract: Turkey detains two Tunisian men in connection with the killing of American Ambassador J Christopher Stevens and three others in Benghazi, Libya, on Sept 11; it is not clear if they are considered suspects or witnesses.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Scott Shane reported from Washington, and Tim Arango from Istanbul. Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Two Tunisians were held in connection with the killing of an American ambassador and three others in Libya on Sept. 11. It was not clear if they were considered suspects or witnesses.

headline.seo: Turkey Holds 2 Tunisians Linked to Libya Attack
headline.main: Turkey Detains 2 in Connection With Killings in Libya
headline.print_headline: 2 Tunisians Detained Over Attack In Libya
